parts.name: CCC.AuditLog.C01.TR01
recommendation
parts.prose: Ensure hash of data is included in digital signature.
When the signature validation process is performed, then it MUST detect any modification of data.

parts.name: CCC.AuditLog.C01.TR02
recommendation
parts.prose: Ensure verification process includes a chained hash function.
When the signature validation process is performed, then it MUST detect any missing (deleted) log file.

controls.title: Implement Digital Signatures With Hash Chaining

parts.name: CCC.AuditLog.C02.TR01
recommendation
parts.prose: Review audit log configuration

When a manual action is performed to generate each audit log type,
then the corresponding audit log type MUST be generated and recorded.

controls.title: Enable And Validate All Audit Log Types

parts.name: CCC.AuditLog.C03.TR01
recommendation
parts.prose: Ensure alerting is correctly configured
When an attempt is made to disable a log source, then an alert MUST be generated.

parts.name: CCC.AuditLog.C03.TR02
recommendation
parts.prose: Ensure alerting is correctly configured

When an attempt is made to alter the retention or object lock status
of an external data log source or bucket, then an alert MUST be generated.

controls.title: Alert On Audit Log Changes And Access

parts.name: CCC.AuditLog.C04.TR01
recommendation
parts.prose:
Configure the audit log bucket to enable server access logging.
Ensure the target logging bucket is configured for appropriate security,
including restricted access and immutability.

When audit log buckets are created then verify that server access
logging MUST be enabled for the audit log bucket,
with logs delivered to a separate, secure logging bucket.

controls.title: Ensure Access Logging Is Enabled on the Audit Log Bucket

groups.title: Controls designed to protected the integrity of Audit Log data.

parts.name: CCC.AuditLog.C05.TR01
recommendation
parts.prose: Configure audit log exporting.
When audit logs are exported, then audit logs MUST be present in the configured data location.

parts.name: CCC.AuditLog.C06.TR01
recommendation
parts.prose:
Configure the audit log bucket's lifecycle rules or object retention settings to enforce
the required data retention period.

When the retention policy is applied, then data MUST
be automatically deleted after the configured number of days.

controls.title: Enforce Retention Policy on Audit Log Bucket

parts.name: CCC.AuditLog.C07.TR01
recommendation
parts.prose:
Enable MFA Delete (or equivalent multi-factor authentication for delete operations)
on the audit log bucket.

When a standard file deletion is attempted on an object within
the audit log bucket, then it MUST be prevented unless MFA is provided.

controls.title: Enforce MFA Delete on Audit Log Bucket

parts.name: CCC.AuditLog.C08.TR01
recommendation
parts.prose: Configure object lock policy.

When an attempt is made to delete data before the object
lock period expires, then the deletion MUST be denied.

controls.title: Enable Object Lock On Audit Log Bucket

groups.title: Controls designed to protected the availability of Audit Log data.

parts.name: CCC.AuditLog.C09.TR01
recommendation
parts.prose: Review field level access controls on audit data.
When restricted fields are accessed by unauthorized users, then those fields MUST remain masked.

controls.title: Restrict Field And Log Type Access

parts.name: CCC.AuditLog.C10.TR01
recommendation
parts.prose:
Configure bucket policies and access control lists (ACLs) to restrict public access.
Regularly review bucket permissions to ensure no public access has been inadvertently granted.

When audit log storage bucket's are created then, bucket's access control settings MUST explicitly deny
public read and write access.

parts.name: CCC.AuditLog.C10.TR02
recommendation
parts.prose:
Configure bucket policies and access control lists (ACLs) to restrict public access.
Regularly review bucket permissions to ensure no public access has been inadvertently granted.

When the URL of a audit log storage bucket's object is accessed publicly then,
it should be denied by bucket policy.

controls.title: Ensure Audit Bucket is Not Publicly Accessible

groups.title: Controls designed to protected the confidentiality of Audit Log data.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C01.TR01
recommendation
parts.prose:
Most cloud services enable TLS 1.3 by default. Where it is not
already set, ensure that your services are configured or updated
accordingly.

When a port is exposed for non-SSH network traffic, all traffic
MUST include a TLS handshake AND be encrypted using TLS 1.3 or
higher.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C01.TR02
recommendation
parts.prose:
Any time port 22 is exposed, ensure that it has a properly
implemented SSH server with SSHv2 enabled and configured with
strong ciphers.

When a port is exposed for SSH network traffic, all traffic MUST
include a SSH handshake AND be encrypted using SSHv2 or higher.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C01.TR03
recommendation
parts.prose:
Review firewall, load balancer, and application configurations to
ensure insecure protocols such as HTTP, FTP, and Telnet are not
exposed. Where possible, implement automatic redirection to secure
protocols such as HTTPS, SFTP, SSH, and regularly scan for
protocol drift.

When the service receives unencrypted traffic, 
then it MUST either block the request or automatically
redirect it to the secure equivalent.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C01.TR07
recommendation
parts.prose:
Reference the IANA Service Name and Transport Protocol Port Number
Registry for more information about correct protocol-to-port
assignments. Avoid running non-standard services on well-known
ports.

When a port is exposed, the service MUST ensure that the protocol
and service officially assigned to that port number by the IANA
Service Name and Transport Protocol Port Number Registry, and no
other, is run on that port.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C01.TR08
recommendation
parts.prose:
Configure mTLS for all endpoints that process or transmit
sensitive data. Ensure both client and server certificates are
validated and managed securely. Regularly review certificate
authorities and automate certificate rotation where possible.

When a service transmits data using TLS, mutual TLS (mTLS) MUST be
implemented to require both client and server certificate
authentication for all connections.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C02.TR01
parts.prose:
When data is stored, it MUST be encrypted using the latest
industry-standard encryption methods.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C06.TR01
recommendation
parts.prose:
Maintain an up-to-date list of trusted and approved regions based
on organizational policies. Validate the service's deployment
location is included in this list.

When the service is running, its region and availability zone MUST
be included in a list of explicitly trusted or approved locations
within the trust perimeter.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C06.TR02
recommendation
parts.prose:
Maintain an up-to-date list of trusted and approved regions based
on organizational policies. Validate that child resources can only
be deployed to locations included in this list.

When a child resource is deployed, its region and availability
zone MUST be included in a list of explicitly trusted or approved
locations within the trust perimeter.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C08.TR01
recommendation
parts.prose:
Implement automated data replication processes to ensure that
data is consistently duplicated in another region or availability
zone. Regularly test data recovery from the replicated location to
ensure integrity and availability.

When data is created or modified, the data MUST have a complete
and recoverable duplicate that is stored in a physically separate
data center.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C08.TR02
parts.prose:
When data is replicated into a second location, the service MUST
be able to accurately represent the replication locations,
replication status, and data synchronization status.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C09.TR01
parts.prose:
When the service is operational, its logs and any child resource
logs MUST NOT be accessible from the resource they record access
to.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C09.TR02
recommendation
parts.prose:
No normal business operations should disable
logs, as this could indicate an attempt to cover up unauthorized
access. Ensure that logging mechanisms are tightly integrated with
service operations, so that logging cannot be disabled without
stopping the service itself.

When the service is operational, disabling the logs for the service
or its child resources MUST NOT be possible without also disabling
the corresponding resource.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C09.TR03
recommendation
parts.prose:
No normal business operations should result in the redirection of
logs, as this could indicate an attempt to cover up unauthorized
access. Ensure that logging configurations are immutable during
service operation so that any changes require stopping the service
and publishing corresponding events to monitored channels.

When the service is operational, any attempt to redirect logs for
the service or its child resources MUST NOT be possible without
halting operation of the corresponding resource and publishing
corresponding events to monitored channels.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C10.TR01
parts.prose:
When data is replicated, the service MUST ensure that replication
only occurs to destinations that are explicitly included within
the defined trust perimeter.

controls.title: Restrict Data Replication to Trust Perimeter

parts.name: CCC.Core.C11.TR01
parts.prose:
When encryption keys are used, the service MUST verify that
all encryption keys use the latest industry-standard cryptographic
algorithms.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C11.TR02
parts.prose:
When encryption keys are used, the service MUST rotate active keys
within 180 days of issuance.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C11.TR03
parts.prose:
When encrypting data, the service MUST verify that
customer-managed encryption keys (CMEKs) are used.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C11.TR04
parts.prose:
When encryption keys are accessed, the service MUST verify that
access to encryption keys is restricted to authorized personnel
and services, following the principle of least privilege.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C11.TR05
parts.prose:
When encryption keys are used, the service MUST rotate active keys
within 365 days of issuance.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C11.TR06
parts.prose:
When encryption keys are used, the service MUST rotate active keys
within 90 days of issuance.

groups.title:
The Data control family ensures the confidentiality, integrity,
availability, and sovereignty of data across its lifecycle.
These controls govern how data is transmitted, stored,
replicated, and protected from unauthorized access, tampering,
or exposure beyond defined trust perimeters.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C03.TR01
parts.prose:
When an entity attempts to modify the service through a user
interface, the authentication process MUST require multiple
identifying factors for authentication.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C03.TR02
parts.prose:
When an entity attempts to modify the service through an API
endpoint, the authentication process MUST require a credential
such as an API key or token AND originate from within the trust
perimeter.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C03.TR03
parts.prose:
When an entity attempts to view information on the service through
a user interface, the authentication process MUST require multiple
identifying factors from the user.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C03.TR04
parts.prose:
When an entity attempts to view information on the service through
an API endpoint, the authentication process MUST require a
credential such as an API key or token AND originate from within
the trust perimeter.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C05.TR01
parts.prose:
When an attempt is made to modify data on the service or a child
resource, the service MUST block requests from unauthorized
entities.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C05.TR02
parts.prose:
When administrative access or configuration change is attempted on
the service or a child resource, the service MUST refuse requests
from unauthorized entities.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C05.TR03
parts.prose:
When administrative access or configuration change is attempted on
the service or a child resource in a multi-tenant environment, the
service MUST refuse requests across tenant boundaries unless the
origin is explicitly included in a pre-approved allowlist.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C05.TR04
parts.prose:
When data is requested from outside the trust perimeter, the
service MUST refuse requests from unauthorized entities.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C05.TR05
parts.prose:
When any request is made from outside the trust perimeter,
the service MUST NOT provide any response that may indicate the
service exists.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C05.TR06
parts.prose:
When any request is made to the service or a child resource, the
service MUST refuse requests from unauthorized entities.

groups.title:
The Identity and Access Management control family ensures
that only trusted and authenticated entities can access
resources. These controls establish strong authentication,
enforce multi-factor verification, and restrict access to
approved sources to prevent unauthorized use or data exfiltration.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C04.TR01
parts.prose:
When administrative access or configuration change is attempted on
the service or a child resource, the service MUST log the client
identity, time, and result of the attempt.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C04.TR02
parts.prose:
When any attempt is made to modify data on the service or a child
resource, the service MUST log the client identity, time, and
result of the attempt.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C04.TR03
parts.prose:
When any attempt is made to read data on the service or a child
resource, the service MUST log the client identity, time, and
result of the attempt.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C07.TR01
recommendation
parts.prose:
Implement event publication mechanisms and alerts for patterns
indicative of enumeration activities, such as repeated access
attempts, requests, or liveness probes. Configure alerts to notify
security teams of any activities that merit further investigation.

When enumeration activities are detected, the service MUST publish
an event to a monitored channel which includes the client
identity, time, and nature of the activity.

parts.name: CCC.Core.C07.TR02
recommendation
parts.prose:
Implement logging mechanisms to capture details of enumeration
activities, including client identity, timestamps, and activity
nature. Retain logs according to organizational policies, and
occasionally review them for patterns that may indicate
reconnaissance activities.

When enumeration activities are detected, the service MUST log the
client identity, time, and nature of the activity.

groups.title:
The Logging & Monitoring control family ensures that access,
changes, and security-relevant events are captured, monitored,
and alerted on in order to provide visibility, support
incident response, and meet compliance requirements.
